required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Branched Chain Aminoacid Supplementation in Patients With Liver Cirrhosis
clinical_study.official_title: High-fiber High-fiber Diet and Branched Chain Aminoacids. Impact on Nutritional Status and Complications in Patients With Liver Cirrhosis

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto Nacional de Ciencias Medicas y Nutricion Salvador Zubiran

clinical_study.source: Instituto Nacional de Ciencias Medicas y Nutricion Salvador Zubiran

brief_summary.textblock:
Malnutrition is a frequent complication in patients with liver cirrhosis. Most patients have decreased dietary intake due to ascites, hepatic encephalopathy and pro-inflammatory cytokines.
We hypothesized that branched chain aminoacids can improve nutritional status and delay episodes of hepatic encephalopathy

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: Assessed by bioelectrical impedance vector analysis and mid-arm muscle circumference

other_outcome.description: Assessed by bioelectrical impedance vector analysis and mid-arm muscle circumference
Assessed by bioelectrical impedance vector analysis and mid-arm muscle circumference

arm_group.description: High-fiber high-protein diet Oral supplement : branched chain aminoacids

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Ambulatory patients Patients with confirmed diagnose of liver cirrhosis Patients classified as Child-Pugh A or Child Pugh B
Exclusion Criteria:
Acute or chronic renal failure Pregnancy Overt hepatic encephalopathy

facility.name: Instituto Nacional de Ciencias Médicas y Nutrición "Salvador Zubirán"

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Instituto Nacional de Ciencias Medicas y Nutricion Salvador Zubiran
